verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak , Build me here seven altars , and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
And Balak did as Balaam had spoken ; and Balak and Balaam offered on \add every\add* altar a bullock and a ram.

And Balaam said unto Balak , Stand by thy burnt offering , and I will go : peradventure the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.\f + \fr 23.3 \ft to an…: or, solitary\f*
And God met Balaam : and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars , and I have offered upon \add every\add* altar a bullock and a ram.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* put a word in Balaam’s mouth , and said , Return unto Balak , and thus thou shalt speak.
And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice , he, and all the princes of Moab.
And he took up his parable , and said , Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram , out of the mountains of the east , \add saying\add*, Come , curse me Jacob , and come , defy Israel.
How shall I curse , whom God hath not cursed ? or how shall I defy , \add whom\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath not defied ?
For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone , and shall not be reckoned among the nations.

Who can count the dust of Jacob , and the number of the fourth \add part\add* of Israel ? Let me die the death of the righteous , and let my last end be like his!\f + \fr 23.10 \ft me: Heb. my soul, or, my life\f*
And Balak said unto Balaam , What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies , and, behold, thou hast blessed \add them\add* altogether.
And he answered and said , Must I not take heed to speak that which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath put in my mouth ? \p

And Balak said unto him, Come , I pray thee, with me unto another place , from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence. \p
¶ And he brought him into the field of Zophim , to the top of Pisgah , and built seven altars , and offered a bullock and a ram on \add every\add* altar.\f + \fr 23.14 \ft Pisgah: or, the hill\f*
And he said unto Balak , Stand here by thy burnt offering , while I meet \add the \+nd Lord\+nd*\add* yonder.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* met Balaam , and put a word in his mouth , and said , Go again unto Balak , and say thus.
And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering , and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spoken ?
And he took up his parable , and said , Rise up , Balak , and hear ; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor :
God \add is\add* not a man , that he should lie ; neither the son of man , that he should repent : hath he said , and shall he not do \add it\add*? or hath he spoken , and shall he not make it good ?
Behold, I have received \add commandment\add* to bless : and he hath blessed ; and I cannot reverse it.

He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob , neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel : the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God \add is\add* with him, and the shout of a king \add is\add* among them.
God brought them out of Egypt ; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.

Surely \add there is\add* no enchantment against Jacob , neither \add is there\add* any divination against Israel : according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel , What hath God wrought !\f + \fr 23.23 \ft against: or, in\f*
Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion , and lift up himself as a young lion : he shall not lie down until he eat \add of\add* the prey , and drink the blood of the slain. \p
¶ And Balak said unto Balaam , Neither curse them at all , nor bless them at all.
But Balaam answered and said unto Balak , Told not I thee, saying , All that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* speaketh , that I must do ? \p
¶ And Balak said unto Balaam , Come , I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place ; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor , that looketh toward Jeshimon.
And Balaam said unto Balak , Build me here seven altars , and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
And Balak did as Balaam had said , and offered a bullock and a ram on \add every\add* altar.
